casebody.data:
JACOB C. REISS, PLAINTIFF-APPELLEE, v. L. BAMBERGER & COMPANY, DEFENDANT-APPELLANT. Decided October 3, 1925.

Before Justices Teen chard and Lloyd.

For the appellant, Biker & Biker. For the defendant, Joseph- C. Paul. Per Curiam.

An examination of the taxation of costs as directed by Mr. Justice Minturn convinces us that the costs were properly taxed, and the appeal is accordingly dismissed.
